result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaac W Margelowsky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol.

Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with Fleet Farm Stores or Meier Stores located in Washington County, WI.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, and shall complete any recommended treatment.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment, schooling or combination of both.
Court authorizes expungement upon successful completion of all aspects of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaac W Margelowsky

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Isaac W Margelowsky in court.  Attorney Gordon R Leech in court for Isaac W Margelowsky. Agreement reached.  State agrees not to charge incident numbers 22-015581, 22-15580, 22-15579, 22-15775, 22-25445; Court acknowledges agreement.  Def enters guilty plea.  Court finds def guilty.  Statements from State, counsel and def.  Court proceeds to sentencing.  Def req expungement; State does not object.  Court authorizes expungement upon successful completion of probation.
Hearing on June 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm- corrected notice sent.

Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Isaac W Margelowsky in court.  Attorney Gordon R Leech in court for Isaac W Margelowsky. Counsel's first appearance.
Hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact with Washington County Fleet Farm stores.

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Isaac W Margelowsky appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Wilfred P. de Junco in court for Isaac W Margelowsky.  Def consents to appearing by video.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. SPD to appoint.  Court sets $500 signature bond.  Court enters NG plea on behalf of def.
Hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
